Gateway

Class Gateway

  • java.lang.Object
    • Gateway.Gateway
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    EventGateway, UserGateway

    public abstract class Gateway
extends java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Gateway(int width, java.lang.String filePath)
      Instantiates a CSV based gateway.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Gateway

        public Gateway(int width,
               java.lang.String filePath)
        Instantiates a CSV based gateway.
        Parameters:
        width - the width of one row.
        filePath - the path to the file that this gateway handles.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if width is less than 1, or if filePath is null.

    • Method Detail

      • getValue

        public java.lang.String getValue(int row,
                                 int col)
        Returns the value in the CSV file at the given coordinates.
        Parameters:
        row - The row to retrieve the cell from indexed starting at 0.
        col - The column to retrieve the cell from indexed starting at 0.
        Returns:
        A string representing the value stored at that cell.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if requested coordinates do not exist currently.

      • clearAll

        public void clearAll()
        Clears the current buffer. Note: This does not write to the file. See flush().

      • update

        public void update(int col,
                   int row,
                   java.lang.String data)
        Updates the cell at the given coordinates. Will generate rows and columns until requested coordinate is reached. Quotes (") and line breaks (\n) are considered illegal. Note: This does not write to the file. See flush().
        Parameters:
        row - The row of the cell to write to indexed starting at 0.
        col - The row of the cell to write to indexed starting at 0.
        data - The data to write.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any of the previously listed character values exist in data string.

      • updateRow

        public void updateRow(int row,
                      java.lang.String[] data)
        Updates an entire row of cells. Will generate rows of empty cells until requested row is reached. Quotes (") and line breaks (\n) are considered illegal. Note: This does not write to the file. See flush().
        Parameters:
        row - The row coordinator starting from 0.
        data - A String[] with each index representing a cell in the row. The length of this array must equal the designated with of the CSV on instantiation which can be retrieved with getColWidth().
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any of the previously stated illegal characters are included, or if the data is not equal to the designated amount of columns.

      • getRow

        public java.lang.String[] getRow(int row)
        Returns an entire row.
        Parameters:
        row - The row to be retrieved, starting at 0.
        Returns:
        a String[] where each index in the array represents a column in the row.

      • getColWidth

        public int getColWidth()
        Returns:
        the width of one row designated on instantiation.

      • getRowCount

        public int getRowCount()
        Returns:
        the current amount of rows in the buffer.

      • flush

        public void flush()
           throws java.io.IOException
        Flushes the buffer into the file. Will create file if it doesn't exist. Will create parent directories up until the given file path if necessary.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - from BufferedWriter.

      • readFromFile

        public void readFromFile()
                  throws java.io.IOException
        Reads the data from the file designated at instantiation.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - if the file does not exist.
        java.io.IOException - from BufferedReader.readLine() and when trying to close said reader.

      • getFilePath

        public java.lang.String getFilePath()
        Returns:
        the file path designated at instantiation.
